subsection.name: Overview
subsection.p: Merlin CLI is the command line interface to the Merlin system. It provides support for the declaration of the root block directive, a working home directory, a kernel directive, and other parameters qualifying debug output and language policy.

The prime objective the Merlin CLI is to launch a root block descriptor and facilitate the deployment of the block and as a consequence, the deployment of subsidiary blocks, containers and components.

subsection.name: Command Line
subsection.p: The Merlin CLI takes a [block] filename as it's primary argument. The block may be a block XML file or a jar file containing a block directive.

p.i: Example of block deployment based on a supplied block directive.

tr.td: Sets the default language country code to the supplied value.
Prints Merlin version information and exit.
Instructs Merlin to issue internal system debug messages.
A relative or absolute path to a working home directory. If not suppled, the system will default to ${user.dir}/home.
A url of a kernel configuration overriding the default kernel directive. The value defaults to ${merlin.home}/config/kernel.xml.
A configuration source containing a set of target configuration fragements that will override configuration entries defined under a block.
Declaration of a local repository. If not suppplied Merlin will default to ${merlin.home}/repository/.

subsection.name: Command Line Qualifiers (non-standard)
subsection.p: Non-standard command line arguments should be considered as experimental and subject to change. Usage without a good understanding of the internals of the Merlin platform is not recommended.

tr.td: Launches a jmx server and registeres the merlin kernal as a managed entity.

Installation of a block archive (.bar file) into the local repository and exists. The -repository argument may be used to select the destination repository for the installation. Resource will be included relative to the bar file group identifier. Existing resources with a modification date equal to or later than the archived entry will be ignored.
